text: is it possible to have sparse arrays of Mean() from OnlineStats.jl?

elements.text: is it possible to have sparse arrays of Mean() from OnlineStats.jl?

text:
Sure!
```julia> using SparseArrays, OnlineStats

julia> sparse([1,4,6], [1,6,9], [Mean(), Mean(), Mean()])
6×9 SparseMatrixCSC{Mean{Float64,EqualWeight},Int64} with 3 stored entries:
  [1, 1]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0
  [4, 6]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0
  [6, 9]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0```

elements.text:
julia> using SparseArrays, OnlineStats

julia> sparse([1,4,6], [1,6,9], [Mean(), Mean(), Mean()])
6×9 SparseMatrixCSC{Mean{Float64,EqualWeight},Int64} with 3 stored entries:
  [1, 1]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0
  [4, 6]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0
  [6, 9]  =  Mean: n=0 | value=0.0

text:
thanks. i want to initialize nxn matrix as Mean() like:
```sparse([Mean() for i=1:3,j=1:3])```

a = sparse([1,4,6], [1,6,9], [Mean(), Mean(), Mean()])

text: Ah, right. You need a `Base.zero(::Type{<:Mean})` method
